psi.client

Interface PsiClient


  • public interface PsiClient
    Interface that provides the methods that perform the client-side computation of the PSI for all the supported algorithms. Instances of this class should be created by calling the methods in the PsiClientFactory class. All the input and output collections are devised to work on Strings in order to facilitate the data exchange between the parties and/or from external data sources. Thus, the conversion of the datasets to String is required and outside the scope of this sdk.

    • Method Detail

      • loadAndEncryptClientDataset

        java.util.Map<java.lang.Long,java.lang.String> loadAndEncryptClientDataset(java.util.Set<java.lang.String> clearClientDataset)
        Loads and encrypts the client dataset passed as input and returns a map of encrypted elements. It performs the client-side encryption of the client dataset. The conversion from Set to Map is needed to assign a unique id to each entry, which links together different stages of the same entry (e.g., allowing to find the clear value associated to a given server-side encrypted entry) This method can be called multiple times with different portions of the client dataset, even concurrently. This method should be called before the loadAndEncryptClientDataset method (at least for the respective entries) and before calling the computePsi method, else the result of the PSI will be an empty set.
        Parameters:
        clearClientDataset - set of elements to be encrypted by the client
        Returns:
        a Map containing for each item of the input set an entry which, as key, has an identifier of the entry computed at runtime, and as value, has the client-side encryption of the item.

      • loadDoubleEncryptedClientDataset

        void loadDoubleEncryptedClientDataset(java.util.Map<java.lang.Long,java.lang.String> doubleEncryptedClientDatasetMap)
        Loads the input map, which should be the server-side encryption of the client dataset. The input of this method should be passed by the server. It is referred as double encrypted client dataset because it is the result of the server-side encryption of the client-side, which was also previously encrypted at the client-side prior to being sent to the server to preserve the privacy of the client. Therefore, both the server and the client applied encryption operations on the entries of the input map. This method can be called multiple times with different portions of the client dataset, even concurrently. This method should be called after the loadAndEncryptClientDataset method (at least for the respective entries) but before calling the computePsi method, else the result of the PSI will be an empty set.
        Parameters:
        doubleEncryptedClientDatasetMap - a map containing the elements to be stored

      • loadAndProcessServerDataset

        void loadAndProcessServerDataset(java.util.Set<java.lang.String> serverEncryptedDataset)
        Loads the input set, which should be associated to entries of the server-side encryption of the server dataset. This method can be called multiple times to load different portions of the server dataset, even concurrently. Depending on the specific PSI algorithm, this method might perform additional computations in addition to simply loading the input set. This method should be called before calling the computePsi method, else the result of the PSI will be an empty set.
        Parameters:
        serverEncryptedDataset - a set containing the elements to be loaded, which are associated to a portion

      • computePsi

        java.util.Set<java.lang.String> computePsi()
        Computes the actual PSI calculation by comparing the entries of the double encrypted client dataset with the processed entries loaded from the server dataset.
        Returns:
        the result of the private set intersection containing the elements present both in the server and client datasets.

      • getClientKeyDescription

        PsiClientKeyDescription getClientKeyDescription()

      • getStatisticList

        java.util.List<psi.model.PsiPhaseStatistics> getStatisticList()
        Retrieves the statistics associated to the different phases of the PSI calculation performed by this object.
        Returns:
        a list containing a different PsiPhaseStatistics for each encryption phase

      • setConfiguration

        void setConfiguration(psi.model.PsiRuntimeConfiguration configuration)
        Configures the number of threads and the max lifetime of each thread used by the PsiClient.
        Parameters:
        configuration - containing the runtime configuration parameters
